TopicTitle: Eyes Turned Skywards UPDATE now with Signup Sheet

Articles.Content:
Tell me more about that rounded hab thing

That seems like something made of procedural parts.
Yup, it's just a procedural structural part.

Hrm, I was going to say it looks a bit like one of Porkjets inflatable hab's, but procedural parts? that's neat.

Cool, where can I download the radiator panels?

There's a beta link for the panels on page#10.

Unwrapped and things, basic texture with AO baked in

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Will fix up the UV's then make the NRM and do the bakes off that

Edited June 28, 2014 by NoMrBond

Hi everyone,

The work so far is looking amazing! It's incredible to see these things morphing into something playable.

After some discussions with the creators of Eyes Turned Skywards, it's been decided to get a bit more 'professional' about things and clarify that Eyes works should go under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. This basically just means that use of the designs and files should include attribution, not be used for commercial purposes, and any derived works be shared under the same conditions - so pretty much what everyone was doing anyway I've updated the ReadMe files to include this license information.

So, now that's out of the way, here are two new Blend files for the Japanese labs on Freedom:

Kibo Lab Module

Centrifuge Gravity Lab
FYI, I've now added links to all of the models prepped so far to the Eyes Turned Skywards Wiki.

Still alive, getting there, just...

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Well sorry for the slow progress (any tips or preferences for the colour palette appreciated)

Edited July 27, 2014 by NoMrBond
Y U No bake AO?

Y U No bake AO?

I did, it's in the prior post to that one

I keep redoing it though because I'm not really happy with the UV's, but unless I draw the line somewhere it's never going to get finished.

[Edit] I changed some of the arrays to linked copies so I could rotate the copies and get the correct shading on the 'outside'

Edited July 27, 2014 by NoMrBond

Nice!

And...supreme apologies to all! Especially e of pi and nixonshead.

Right about when I thought I could devote serious time to this, .24 entered experimentals and I haven't had time to do much of anything since other than update broken mods.
This is one mod that I want oh so badly when it comes out.

This is one mod that I want oh so badly when it comes out.

i agree with you 10000% sir
Just for some inspiration, here's a screenshot of my take on the Freedom station. This was back in .23.5, and i'm still waiting for the mods to update to .24.2.
Looks good, but I would say a 3.75m scaled FusTek module or Procedural structural part would suit Challenger module more.
Thanks, that was my older version. While I am waiting for the rest of my mods to update, I am working on a rescale of the fustek modules

Just for some inspiration, here's a screenshot of my take on the Freedom station. This was back in .23.5, and i'm still waiting for the mods to update to .24.2.

What mods you have there? FusTek Expansion, and maybe Near Future (possibly KOSMOS) for the panels. Don't recognize the rest...

You know how I said I would draw the line on the UV's? Yeah, didn't happen, redid them again, as an upside found and removed a bunch of duplicate faces so the whole thing is around the 3-4 mainsail level in terms of tri/face 'load'

Unfortunately this resets the texture back to basically zero, although it should be faster to rebuild now

Managed to integrate the HRS panels on there too, no time to test if the suncatcher is working though

What mods you have there? FusTek Expansion, and maybe Near Future (possibly KOSMOS) for the panels. Don't recognize the rest...

I can spot FASA in there (or Danny's Saturn V mod, can't tell the difference at that res).
NoMrBond, that AO looks a little weak. Are you multiplying the layer? Is it on top?

NoMrBond, that AO looks a little weak. Are you multiplying the layer? Is it on top?

Yes, and yes. The base under the AO/Mult layer is flat #969696 and that Blender scene is using indirect lighting
Sorry to bump, but when do you guys think the first version of this will be released?
*bump* lol

Just a heads up, I'm still currently working on Spacelab, just a bit delayed with .24 being released and having to transition to a new 3D Modeling program for Uni.

Not sure about everyone else, but I'm hoping to have Spacelab done completely by the end of the month, including IVA and science experiments.

Unless there are specific colours desired for certain sections (I've tried to keep the ones from the ETS example files) I just need to make the sun (edge) tracking work again and I'll roll up another release for feedback

It's set up exactly like the preceding HRS panels but it just won't rotate for some reason
It's looking good, all. Can't wait to see some stations in-game with these parts.

Beta-1 release of the S1 truss w/ integrated HRS panels, over 2000 m2 of radiative power can be yours!

Known problems; Panels are still tracking the sun instead of turning edge on

Missing; No normal map yet
